posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: So just got back home from a long meeting. Today we set up our new Swerve Chassis. In order to have some sort of starting point we downloaded some swerve code off of Git. Prior to this, I, a builder/programmer, tried to ping our new RoboRio 2 using CMD and it failed. However, DS station showed as connected, but Phoenix tuner wouldn’t connect either. So, all is very confusing. Let me know what I should try tomorrow.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Did you image the SD card ?

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
Can you share a screenshot of the Driver Station with the Diagnostics Tab open?

Can you share a screenshot of the last pageful from the VSCode Terminal indicating successful code deployment?

link_counts.title: FRC Driver Station Powered by NI LabVIEW — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: I will have to do this tomorrow. But as soon as I do, I’ll send it

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: What would you be looking for there?

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
From your description, it sounds like either you are not in communication with the rio, or you are not successfully deploying robot code.

The Diagnostics Tab gives us a lot of detail about the communication status.

You can see on the “Robot Code” indicator in the middle of the Driver Station.  It should turn red briefly when you’re deploying code, and then back to green.  There are unfortunately several ways for a VSCode build to appear successful when it didn’t actually deploy code to the robot.

Oh, and can you access the roboRIO Web Dashboard ( http://10.TE.AM.2/ for Wifi)?

link_counts.title: roboRIO Web Dashboard — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked:
Have you configured it with the Team Number over USB?

The NI roboRIO 2.0 boots from a microSD card configured with an appropriate boot image containing the NI Linux Real-Time OS, drivers, and libraries specific to FRC. The microSD card must be imaged ...

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: It looks like something is corrupted in your build.gradle file?  Can you post your project somewhere, or at least the build.gradle file?

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked:
image 1920×2560 424 KB So we are connected, but the robot light on the DS is not lit. Just the radio.

image 1920×2560 424 KB

image 1920×2560 424 KB

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Are you sure this is the imported build.gradle? It uses a 2021 GradleRio version. Are you using the 2023 installation of VS Code?

Also, I see your project is stored in One Drive. That’s caused trouble for people before.

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked: Your code is not building.   See the red “BUILD FAILED” in VSCode.  As Peter says, it would help to see your code (e.g. on Github).  Also, can you talk us through how you are triggering the build?

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: We made a change to the code, now it builds, but won’t deploy because it isn’t connected to the bot properly.

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: We’ve also tried using direct Ethernet to the bot.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: What is the full error message?

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: We hooked USB up, and it deployed immediately! So, does that mean we have a bad Ethernet port?
